text: When you open the Uber app,
you'll see several options at the top.

For this tutorial, we'll be
showing you how to book a ride.
Use the clickable sections below

to skip to different
features of the Uber app.
Before you book a ride,

make sure you have entered a
payment method into the app.
To do this, tap the menu icon

in the upper left-hand
corner of the screen
and then tap "Wallet."
Under the Payment Methods section,

make sure an active
payment method is listed

or tap "Add Payment Method or
Redeem Gift Card" to add one.

To book a ride, start by
tapping the "Ride" button
or tapping the "Where to?" field.
If you'd like, you can also choose to tap
the "Now" button in the "Where to?" field

to schedule a ride for a
pickup time in the future.
Enter the address of your destination
in the "Where to?" field.
If you don't have an exact address,
you can also tap "Select location on map,"

which will let you drop a
pin at your desired location.
Once you've entered a destination,

Uber will offer you several
different car options,
each that fit a different number of people
and come with different price tags.

The typical options are
UberX, Uber Black, and UberXL.
UberX is usually the cheapest option.
Uber Black is usually more expensive,

because this ride will
be in a premium car.

UberXL features bigger
cars, vans, and SUVs.
Next to each option,
you'll see how many passengers can fit.

You'll notice that next to your
current location on the map,

it shows how long it will take
for the car you've selected
to get to your location to pick you up.
As you consider different car options,
the waiting time changes accordingly.
You'll also notice under each car option
is an expected drop-off time.

Choose your desired car and
tap the "Confirm" button
at the bottom of the screen.

Uber may ask you to confirm
your pickup spot again,

so the driver is clear
on where to find you.

Once your pickup spot is
set, tap "Confirm Pickup."

Uber may also ask you
to confirm your fare,
especially if prices are high
due to high demand at the moment.
Tap "CONFIRM FARE" to continue.
Uber will then match you to a driver
and will show you their live location

as they make their way
to your pickup spot.
If you ever need to contact the driver

as they are navigating
to your pickup spot,
you can tap the phone icon.
As the Uber is arriving,

you can confirm it's the
right car by making sure

the license plate and model
of the approaching car

matches the license plate
and model shown in the app.
Once you're riding in the Uber,

you can follow your
location live on the map

and also see your live
estimated arrival time.

If you need to change your
drop-off destination mid-ride,
you can do so by tapping "Add or Change."

Doing this might change
the price of your ride,
but Uber will confirm this with you
before any changes are made.
You will also find options
to share your location with others,
change payment methods,
and split fares.

You can also tap "Safety" to
access various safety tools
that Uber offers during the ride,

such as reporting a safety
issue or calling 911.

After the ride is over,
you can give your driver
a rating or a tip if you'd like
by tapping the three horizontal lines
in the upper left corner,
tapping "Your Trips,"
selecting your trip,

and tapping on the stars
next to the driver's name.
